outline.deftn: materials for evaluation or measurements of progress, development, ability, skill, understanding, knowledge, aptitude or achievement

outline.vocab: Online educator tools (quiz makers, free email, web hosting sites)
outline.text: Online educator tools (quiz makers, free email, web hosting sites)

outline.deftn: a correct solution or response to a question, problem or test
a collection of student work that demonstrates academic progress or knowledge acquisition over a period of time
statements describing the abilities, knowledge, or understanding of a content area in order to reach a certain level of mastery

an oral or written examination comprising questions, exercises, and/or problems that measure the skill, knowledge, capacity, or aptitude of an individual or group; may or may not include an answer key
representations other than text
visual representation of data with the purpose of providing meaning to the data (use for: pie charts, line graphs)
visual material used to clarify or annotate pieces of text (use for: drawing, diagram)
visual material that is not in motion and is not intended to annotate pieces of text (use for: poster, digital image of a painting or print)
representation of physical features or data of a discrete area, often done on a flat surface at a point in time (use for: topographic map, soil map, road map, bedrock map, or atlas)

in-motion, dynamic, audio/visual material played in a linear fashion and often not related to a specific date in time (use for: webcast about a science concept, podcast); (see Broadcast for concert, performance, newscast)

outline.deftn: vocal, instrumental, electronically-produced, or mechanical sound featuring rhythm, melody and/or harmony
image produced by radiant energy, especially visible light (use for: photo, digital camera, or computer generated photograph, slide)
non-musical, non-vocal, recorded auditory material (use for: natural world, mechanical, noise, tones)
recorded material that tends to be descriptive in nature; may or may not be drawn from written texts (use for: audio book, oral history, interview, podcast)
any book or chapter that can't be classified by the above groups
portals, large sets or groups of related materials
resources facilitating communications and interactions
resource affording the ability to submit questions to a responsive individual or group possessed with specific expertise in the area of interest
meeting or medium (synchronous/asynchronous) enabling the exchange of views (use for: message board, chat)
email-based communication that is usually topic-focused and distributed to a member-based group of individuals via a single email address and including the archive of the email list

outline.vocab: Student Email interaction (includes Keypals, Ask an Expert services)
outline.text: Student Email interaction (includes Keypals, Ask an Expert services)

outline.deftn: a web-based publication consisting primarily of articles or entries, written by one person or a group
website that allows visitors to add, remove, edit, link, and change content, typically without the need for registration

visual, factual, or numerical information that comes from a sensing device, whether instrument-measured or human-observed; describes both unprocessed, raw information as well as information already organized into lists, tables, or databases

outline.vocab: Datasets and Tools:Datasets with Teaching Activities
outline.text: Datasets and Tools:Datasets with Teaching Activities

outline.vocab: Datasets and Tools:Datasets with Teaching Activities
outline.text: Datasets and Tools:Datasets with Teaching Activities

outline.deftn: information held electronically and organized for rapid search and retrieval by a computer
factual or numerical information arranged for ready reference and interpretation by users
visual, factual or numerical information generated from human observations or in-situ instrument measurements

outline.vocab: Importation of field observations into the classroom
outline.text: Importation of field observations into the classroom

outline.deftn: imagery generated from measuring devices that are not in direct contact with the medium they are measuring (use for: radar or satellite imagery)
one of a number of repetitions of an experiment
a non-persistent, time-based occurrence
monetary or honorary acknowledgement bestowed for merit, research, performance, study, writing, or other professional/educational endeavors (includes honorarium or stipends)

media presentation (audio, video and/or text) prepared and intended for a wide or specific audience, often with limited or controlled audience participation, occurring on a certain date and often archived for later use; may lose relevancy over time (use for: concert webcast, podcast, newscast, or talk show)

time-sensitive invitation for contribution, involvement or input on a product, event, or project (use for: call for papers, call for input, testing, feedback, formative evaluations, or collaborations)
physical or virtual meeting of broad or tightly focused appeal targeted for a specific academic and/or professional community and typically sponsored
a non-permanent display of artifacts, images, or resources organized around a particular theme or topic

activity whose primary object is professional/academic development and practical research experience; may or may not include a stipend or honorarium (use for: field project, course, internship, mentoring, tutoring, exchange, or college credit opportunity)
position for which participants receive remuneration (pay for work done but not a stipend or honorarium) (use for: postdoc, internship, fellowship, assistantship, or research associateship)
general information or announcement that loses its immediate relevancy after a short time (use for: newsletter, press release)
short-term meeting or interaction, typically with a well-defined outcome like professional-skills development
materials intended to facilitate teaching or enable learning
non-laboratory material designed to stimulate learning and help students develop particular skills, specific knowledge, or reflexive habits of mind
a comment, review, graphic, question, tip, or link associated with an existing resource and providing further explanation, expansion, and/or reaction
resource offering intensive analysis of discrete, or a combination of, peoples, locations, environments, objects, time periods, or concepts
a set of teaching materials (generally for instructors) or learning materials (generally for students) intended to achieve a range of objectives over an extended period of time
a program of study which may or may not include assessment material

a resource that exposes the nature and requirements of a procedure, process, or principle by manipulating real objects (term is distinct from Simulation in that demonstrations have real objects in them as opposed to representations)
a scientific procedure undertaken to make a discovery, test a hypothesis, or demonstrate a known fact [Compact Oxford English Dictionary]
excursion to a place to gain firsthand information, knowledge, or experience (use for: descriptions or plans for field trips, virtual field trips)

outline.vocab: Activities:Field Activity:Importation of field observations into the classroom
outline.text: Activities:Field Activity:Importation of field observations into the classroom

outline.vocab: Importation of field observations into the classroom
outline.text: Importation of field observations into the classroom

outline.deftn: an interactive environment in which participants compete, strategize, play, role-play, troubleshoot, or make decisions in order to learn a subject or skill
a guideline, pedagogical description, or tip for effective teaching and learning
resource for teachers regarding the use of learning materials with respect to educational objectives, classroom management, materials development, assessment, and additional reference material
a representation of a system, process or environment where learners control and manipulate variables or other objects to affect outcomes (use for: applet, mathlet)
audio or text record of a speech or a unit of instruction organized and delivered by an instructor for the purpose of informing a group about a topic
resource to support students' learning of specific concepts, skills, or content; often includes teaching instructions, educational goals, learning objectives, and procedures
a mathematical or physical construct intended to study or represent a real-world system or phenomenon
series of tasks or questions posed to the student, as in homework or other assignment (use for: worksheet)
individual or group activity or problem that supplements and applies classroom studies and often results in a product
imitative representation of a system, process, photo, setting, or principle (note that the imitative nature of Simulation distinguishes it from a Demonstration, which employs real objects)
resource for learners to help facilitate learning and comprehension of subject matter content (use for: lab manual, study guide, workbook)
plan showing the structure of a particular course, including course description and objectives, grading policy, materials, assignments, lesson sequence, and course calendar [iLumina]
resource providing comprehensive materials for specific topics (use for: chapters or other typical book components) [ENC]
resource that provides guided information about a specific subject

a set of teaching materials, generally for instructors, or alternatively learning materials, generally for students, intended to achieve specific and focused objectives over a limited period of time such that units often constitute a Course
information intended as an authoritative source or to stimulate topical research
condensed version or summary of a larger piece of work outlining major points and conclusions [DLESE]

generally nonfiction writing communicating ideas, concepts, results, or facts; often, but not always, part of a monograph, journal, magazine, or newspaper (use for: essays, information sheets, pamphlets, brochures, preprints)
a list, often with descriptive or critical notes, of writings relating to a particular subject, period or author [Merriam-Webster Online]

resource describing specific science, technology, engineering, and mathematic (STEM) information and/or insight into STEM careers and requisite skills (use for: camps, internship programs, or informational programs which inform and support individuals interested in pursuing STEM careers)
resource providing guidelines or methods for identifying, sorting, or categorizing objects (use for: cloud chart, soil chart, taxonomic keys)
level of achievement to which learners or educators are expected to aspire
frequently asked questions about a topic, organization, or event that are intended to help users
narrative or verse describing imaginary events, people, or objects (use for: prose literature, novels, poems)

a compiled or alphabetical list of words relating to a specific subject, situation, text, or dialect that variously include definitions, explanations, page references, or descriptions (use for: dictionary, table of contents)
set of preliminary ideas and thoughts, generally in a list-like format, about a project, paper, or other endeavor
writing describing facts, places, events, and things but not including instructional activities

outline.text: Scientific Resources: Overview and Reference Works

outline.deftn: materials in any medium issued under the same title with discrete parts or articles, appearing at regular or irregular intervals; may or may not describe materials with peer review (use for: journal, peer-reviewed journal, magazine, serial)
document containing statements or series of steps for a particular way of accomplishing a goal [DLESE]
collection of papers or abstracts presented at a specific meeting or event with defined outcomes
a formal document detailing an intended or future project, recommendation, plan, or idea
detailed account or statement, often outlining the results or events of a meeting, endeavor, activity, topic, issue, or study (use for: review, reviews, evaluation, monograph)
information regarding physical constants, units of measurement, expressing uncertainty of measurement, conversion factors, and equations
an object from the natural world that is intended for study (use for: rock sample, lab sample, cultures, insect)
research text written in partial fulfillment of the requirements for an academic degree (typically postgraduate)
materials for professional development servives
primarily publishers textbooks and chapters
computer hardware or software that facilitates interacting with a resource
set of computer instructions or scripts that enhance a resource; generally does not stand alone
physical device or implement needed to interact with a resource
formatted document containing blank fields that users populate with data (use for: calculator, online survey form)
set of computer instructions intended to operate on a Dataset in order to understand the natural world by predicting current, past, or future situations given a set of initial conditions
mechanism by which the web or a sub-component thereof is searched, prompted by a specific query entered by a user

stand-alone tool that provides access, interaction, and the ability to run resources; it does not enhance another piece of software and it is distinct from Numerical Model (use for: data analysis tools, content creation tools)
